DataElement.preferredName: Household Survey Prior Diagnosis Child Other Guardian Main Daily Activities or Responsibilities Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's response, who is a guardian or other parent, about which activity describes their main daily activities or responsibilities prior to their child's diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Household Survey Prior Diagnosis Child Other Guardian Main Daily Activities or Responsibilities
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A social unit comprised of one or more individuals living together (all of whom need not be related) in the same dwelling, who aggregate and share their incomes._A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people._Earlier in time or order._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A person who is not yet an adult. The specific cut-off age will vary by purpose._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._An individual who is authorized under applicable State or local law to consent on behalf of a child or incapable person to general medical care including participation in clinical research._A question that requests a description of an individual's main daily activities or responsibilities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A social unit comprised of one or more individuals living together (all of whom need not be related) in the same dwelling, who aggregate and share their incomes.:A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.

Concepts.definition: A social unit comprised of one or more individuals living together (all of whom need not be related) in the same dwelling, who aggregate and share their incomes.
A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.

Property.preferredName: Prior Diagnosis Child Other Guardian Main Daily Activities or Responsibilities
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:A person who is not yet an adult. The specific cut-off age will vary by purpose.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:An individual who is authorized under applicable State or local law to consent on behalf of a child or incapable person to general medical care including participation in clinical research.:A question that requests a description of an individual's main daily activities or responsibilities.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
An age group comprised of individuals who are not yet an adult. The specific cut-off age will vary by purpose.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An individual who is authorized under applicable State or local law to consent on behalf of a child or incapable person to general medical care including participation in clinical research.
A question that requests a description of an individual's main daily activities or responsibilities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To stop working at one's occupation; the state of being retired.

Concepts.definition: To stop working at one's occupation; the state of being retired.

PermissibleValues.value: Raising children full-time or keeping house
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Raising Children Full-time or Keeping House

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Raising Children Full-time or Keeping House
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that an individual is employed in their home, either raising children full-time or keeping house.

Concepts.longName: Raising Children Full-time or Keeping House
Concepts.definition: An indication that an individual is employed in their home, either raising children full-time or keeping house.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that an individual is seeking work.

Concepts.definition: An indication that an individual is seeking work.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The state of not having a job.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: An indication that an individaul is not working due to being laid off.

Concepts.definition: The state of not having a job.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An indication that an individual is not working due to being laid off.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Yes, started working part time hours (< 30 hours per week)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Yes, started working part time hours (< 30 hours per week)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is working part time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is working part time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Employed for a standard number of hours of working time, at least 50% or 20 hours per week

Concepts.definition: Employed for a standard number of hours of working time, at least 50% or 20 hours per week.

ReferenceDocuments.description: If your child has another parent/guardian, which of the following best describes his/her main daily activities and/or responsibilities before your child's diagnosis?
